title: Create compliance reports based on organization scopes
content:
By default, SAM performs compliance calculations globally. While in many business scenarios, licenses are centrally purchased but allocated to different organizations. Asset mangers would like to know the license usage per organization in order to adjust license allocation across different organizations for internal license management purpose.

This page gives example steps on how to perform calculations based on organization compliance scopes. As you can create scopes by location, by cost center, or by custom criteria, here we take location scopes as a typical example in the following steps.

Create organization compliance scopes

A company owns subsidiaries overseas in different locations, then the admin user can firstly create the location-based scopes in  Run > Software Asset > Configurations > Organization compliance scopes. 

For example:

  • Scope 1 for China
  • Scope 2 for United States
  • Scope 3 for Canada

Then, set all these compliance scopes as Active.

Manage required information for license and device records

After you create these location scopes, you need to make sure that the software and hardware assets are properly maintained with location information.

To assign a location to a device:

  1. From the main menu, select Build > Service Asset & Configuration.

  2. From SACM Home, select Devices, and then select the desired device record.

  3. On the General tab page, go to the Overview section, and make sure the device location is specified.

  4. Save the changes.

To assign a location to a license:

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Software Asset.

  2. Go to the Licenses page and select the required license record.
  3. On the General tab page, make sure the Located at location field is specified.
If your Service Management is upgraded from a previous version, make sure that your tenant admin has added the Located at location field to the Full License form.

Define compliance scope type

After you maintained your organization compliance scopes, you need to define Compliance scope type in the Products page.

  • For on-premises products, you may set the organization compliance scope in the Compliance calculation settings tab.

  • For SaaS products, you may set the organization compliance scope in the Settings tab.

For example, you may set Global scope and organization scope for each product, thus SAM performs the compliance calculations for both global scope and organization scopes.

  • For on-premises products, when you import license consumption data from the integrated product, you may configure the Organization compliance scope parameter and import data for each scope. If you import data for the global scope, you may leave the Organization compliance scope parameter empty. See Scenario to configure for each product.
    For SaaS products, when you import license consumption data and user entitlement data from the SaaS product, you may configure the Organization compliance scope parameter and import data for each scope. If you import data for the global scope, you may leave the Organization compliance scope parameter empty. See Scenarios to configure for each SaaS product.
  • We recommend using the Queries feature to filter out unwanted location records and enhance performance. For example, to generate reports at the Site level, select the Location record type and configure the Or relations for the Type field to reflect the same hierarchical level, such as (Type = Region OR Type = Country OR Type = City OR Type = Office). SAM will then recursively query the device and license information for each office.

View compliance by scope

After you calculate license consumption, when you view compliance status under the Dashboard tab page, the compliance scopes are displayed in the left side panel for you to view the compliance results based on each scope.

When you view the compliance results under the Product compliance tab page, the compliance scopes are also displayed in the left side panel. By default, the Goup by: Organization compliance scope > Product.Publisher group view is selected, you can view the compliance information from the aspect of scope. If you want to view the compliance information from the aspect of product, you may switch to Goup by: Product.Publisher >Product.

The Calculation status field indicates the product calculating status per organization:
  • Succeeded: the product compliance was successfully calculated.
  • Succeeded-No data: the product compliance was  successfully calculated. However, there's no related license and software installation detected (e.g. The product is not deployed in an organization).
  • Failed: The product compliance calculation was failed.

View license usage by scope

When you view license usage records, license consumption results of the product are also displayed based on the scopes. You may refer to the Organization compliance scope field to view the license consumption results for each scope, and for the global scope.

For example, you may select Product under Group by from the left side bar, then you can get a summary of the license usage information for each product. When you select a certain product, you can view the license usage based on each scope for this product.
